data.text:
@AndreAlessi the firm belief that every person can easily distinguish between good and evil, and between right and wrong"

LOL!

@cindybax @AndreAlessi She is not holding herself out as providing legal advice in the “reserved areas of [legal] work” and the doc where she is referred to as “attorney at law” is not hers, so any breach is at the very low end. Still may be an offence but hardly a Slamus Dunkus (legal term)
@lawgeeknz @AndreAlessi worth a complaint to the Law Society?

@lawgeeknz @AndreAlessi For the Sasha Stone International Tribunal for Natural Justice, Sue Grey was referred to as Dr Grey. But given one of the "judges" John Walsh a lawyer disbarred from his practice in Victoria, who former chancellor of Grenwich University, an unaccredited uni, why not.
@lawgeeknz @AndreAlessi Exactly she’s not on the Law Soc register she has no practising certificate.

@lawgeeknz @AndreAlessi It’s actually an offence in NZ to refer to yourself as a lawyer/attorney etc when, like Claire Deeks, you don’t hold a current practising certificate. I know it’s small fry in the scheme of what’s going on, but still. Hopefully @nzlawsociety is aware
@lawgeeknz @AndreAlessi Somehow I doubt that the relationship with facts, evidence and truth will depend on who you ask
